Header: U.S. agents launch tear gas at migrants
Content: U.S. border agents launched tear gas at migrants to deter them from crossing the U.S.-Mexico border at Tijuana in the early hours of Tuesday.Clouds of the noxious gas could be seen wafting up from around the fence at the border and one migrant picked up a canister and threw it back across the border into U.S. territory.The recent deaths of two migrant children in U.S. custody have intensified the debate over U.S. immigration policy as President Donald Trump holds onto his demand that lawmakers give him $5 billion to fund a wall along the border with Mexico. Felipe Gomez Alonzo, 8, died on Christmas Day. In early December, 7-year-old Jakelin Caal died after being detained along with her father by U.S. border agents in a remote part of New Mexico. Trump sees the wall as vital to stemming illegal immigration, while Democrats and some Republicans see it as impractical and costly.
